intro: Digitorebutia nazarenoensis, commonly known as the Nazareno's digitaria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often vibrant flowers. The plant typically features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cooler, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
